result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: To Count 2 amended, and Count 3 amended. Consecutive to Count 4.
Court will allow work release.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1 amended only. 
Court WAIVED DNA surcharge on counts 2 and 3 as amended and count 4 as they are part of a continuous series of events.
If revoked, court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession; Voting.

No contact with the victim H.L.A. outside of a therapeutic setting.
Defendant may have contact in therapeutic setting only with consent of therapist and H.L.A.
No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 16 years. Any conditions of unsupervised contact with biological children is to be followed pursuant to Childrens Court order.

Comply with all Childrens Court orders.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment and counseling.
Provide agent with a list of prescriptions. Any new prescriptions must be provided to agent BEFORE filling them.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED to be used at the agents discretion. If employed when ordered to serve condition time, defendant is allowed work release.
If defendant is revoked and is employed at the time of revocation, Court will allow work release. Defendant may also be considered for the Day Reporting Center and any job training programs within the institution.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: To Count 1 amended and Count 3 amended. 
Consecutive to Count 4.
Court will allow work release; credit for 29 days.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED to be used at the agents discretion. If employed when ordered to serve condition time; defendant is allowed work release.
If defendant is revoked and is employed at the time of revocation, Court will allow work release. Defendant may also be considered for the Day Reporting Center and any job training programs within the institution.

Concurrent with: To Count 1 amended and Count 2 amended.
Consecutive to Count 4.
Court will allow work release; credit for 29 days time served.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED to be used at agents discretion. If employed when ordered to serve condition time, defendant is allowed work release.
If defendant is revoked and is employed at the time of revocation, Court will allow work release. Defendant may also be considered for the Day Reporting Center and any job training programs within the institution.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

timeConds.notes:
STAYED to be used at agents discretion. If employed when ordered to serve condition time, defendant is allowed work release.
If defendant is revoked and is employed and is employed at the time of revocation, Court will allow work release. Defendant may also be considered for the Day Reporting Center and any job training programs within the institution.
Consecutive to: To Counts 1, 2 & 3. 
Court will allow work release.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for hearing. Probation Agent Michelle Diehl also in court. Discussion regarding probation status report and agent Diehl's request for modification. Court will impose 30 days of condition time, which is a time served disposition. Discussion regarding defendant's contact with his children. Defendant is not to have contact with his children until he has participated in the required assessments and registration. Once completed, the defendant may have supervised contact with his children as authorized by the ongoing case manager and the Department of Corrections. Court ordered the vists may NOT be supervised by the mother. State to provide the Court with a copy of the dispositional order from Children's Court.
Order to Seal signed and filed. Copy of the Children's Court Dispositional Order is ordered sealed as a part of the court file. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court, defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set further proceedings. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction, defense counsel does not waive his appearance. Probation agent Michelle Diehl also in court. Discussion regarding probation agent's request to the court for modification of probation conditions. Court ordered this matter be set for a hearing. State will do OTP. At the next court date, the State will provide the court with the dispositional order from the Children's Court case if one has been entered. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered this matter be set on the calendar to address DOC's request to impose condition time. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 11/25/14 at 8:30 a.m. for Further Proceedings in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to JUDGE ROTHSTEIN
for review. OS

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. Statements made as to sentencing. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case passed to 2:00 p.m. for continuation of sentencing hearing.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNTS 1, 2 & 3 as amended and COUNT 4-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY as to all counts.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
Conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. State filed a second amended information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.50(3)(c) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2- Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.50(3)(c) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 3- Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.50(3)(h) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 4- Disorderly Conduct, contrary to sec. 947.01(1) Wis. Stats., a Class B Misdemeanor. 

Defense acknowledged receipt of second amended information and waived reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
On motion of the defense, Court will reduce bail to $1,500.00 cash bail. Remaining $1,500.00 to be returned to the poster. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Arguments heard as to defense request to modify the no contact order. Court will allow modification of the no contact order to allow the victim H.A. to visit her father while he is in the hospital under the supervision of the ongoing case manager or that case manager's supervisor ONLY. Defense counsel to draft a statement of the modification of the bail for the court file.

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defendant does not appear, he is in the hospital following a severe burn incident. Court waived his appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel believes this matter will resolve short of trial and requests a projected plea date. Court will vacate jury trial date of 9/02/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Trial Adjournment received and notified. Court ordered this matter set on the calendar as soon as possible. State and defense counsel in co-defendant's case notified. Case adjourned for Motion Hearing to 8/25/14 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
of Alibi,received and filed.

Justice Point violation report - positive drug test - received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Discussion regarding Justice Point report. Review of records by Branch 19 will be completed today and then sent to Branch 25. Due to Monday being a holiday, Court will not have time to review the records and issue a ruling by the jury trial date. Court vacated the jury trial date of 5/27/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties were in Children's Court yesterday to address Bellows motion filed by defense. Court will be in receipt of victim's bureau records for an in-camera review. Defense counsel requests adjournment of jury trial date due to the records review and possible missing discovery. Court orders State to disclose any reports or witness names who took statements from the victim. Court ordered a status date be set prior to the jury trial date to check on the progress of these records being turned over. State made a request for the Court to order the defendant to have no contact with the West Allis police detectives in this matter. Court denied motion for reasons placed on the record. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 05/27/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation report - positive drug test- received and filed. Defendant has a valid prescription. Court took no further action at this time. Deputy court clerk ccp.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Miriam S Falk on behalf of Jennifer Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Discussion regarding justice point reports and violation report. Defendant has a valid prescription. Defense counsel has been provided with an additional statement made by the victim in this case. State is prepared to proceed to trial even with the additional statement. Defense counsel requests additional final pretrial date to investigate new statement and meet with the State. Defense counsel to file witness lists and jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 05/27/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point violation report received and filed. Defendant has positive drug test, but has a valid prescription. Court took no further action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel made oral bail motion at the end of today's hearing. Court modified bail conditions as follows: Defendant must be in his residence between 6:00 p.m. and 7:00 a.m. Defendant may leave his residence during allowed hours subject to conditions previously ordered by the Court.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Witness lists and substantive jury instructions to be filed by 05/07/2014. Defense counsel requested adjourned final pretrial date due to children's court action. Attorney Anderson (counsel in co-defendant's case 14CF320) and State do not object. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 05/27/2014 at 9:00 a.m. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for jury trial and final pretrial in Br 25. Motions should be filed on or before 3-7-14.    Justice Point report received and filed and reviewed by all parties.  On defense request, defendant is allowed release from home confinement for job search and for union activities.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM006470  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/6/14 vf

Bail motion by defense argued.  Court heard argument from both parties.  Court grants the defense motion. 
Court set bail at $3000 cash with the following conditions: 
- turn over to Justice Point 
- no contact with victim, HLA
- no unsupervised contact with defendant's other minor children, Dillon A, and Dawson A. unless supervised by a licensed welfare professional NOTE: ongoing case manager may supervise visitation
- no discussion of pending matters during visits
- absolute sobriety
- random drug testing
- no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
- no firearms
- must remain home, except for employment and the birth of his child
 - comply with all existing CHIPS orders
Case adjourned to 2-17-14 at 8:30 for scheduling conference.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in custody.   Jennifer Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Letters received on defendant's behalf were received and reviewed by the court.
for Bail Modification, signed and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Joseph E Schubert.  Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  West Allis Police Detective Jessica Wink.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference.  Arraignment scheduled for 02-05-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HLA dob 3/4/99; MHB dob 11/18/98; DCA dob 1/20/03; DCDA dob 2/18/04 and their residences/workplaces/school unless supervised by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Jeffrey Dewayne Armstrong in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
